This can be verified by checking divisibility by all integers less than its square root (approximately 7.8). It turns out that 61 cannot be divided evenly by any of these numbers. For example, both 61 and 16 (when considered as 16 being a prime number for this context) are prime. However, strictly speaking, 16 is not a prime number because it can be divided by 2 and 8.
